page.title: 15Conservation at Steel Heath
page.content: Date line 28th June 1985. A proposed management agreement for Steel Heath,one of N. Shropshires last remaining pieces of land of it kind is to be explained at a Prees P.C. meeting on July 18th.Its the Nature Conservation Trust that has drawn up the management agreement.It has been approved by the N.S.D.C's environ- mental health and general services comm,which also agreed with the prin- ciple of Steel Heath being designated as a local nature reserve.The heath straddling the Wem/Whitchurch Rd.near Tilstock is considered to be ideal for conservation being a rare habitat for plants and wildlife,containing lots of interesting species of birds and butterflies.Coun.J.Morris has urged the involvement of Tilstock School and an invitation to the public meeting.
